website_summaries.verdict: Foam box comes with jump sizes including 20", 24", and 30" with a 60lb base.
pros: Anti-slip surface makes for safe jumps with or without athletic footwear
Foam construction and rounded edges minimize impact injuries
Comes with a 100% satisfaction guarantee and customer support
Wide enough to let you land with feet shoulder-length apart
cons: Some consumers feel the foam has too much give in it, especially for heavier individuals

customer_reviews.title: The foam box helped me get over my fear of box jumps!
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing Crossfit for 3 years and I have been steadily working my way up to Women's RX box jumps but I've been too scared to jump on the 20 inch wooden box at the gym. I bought this foam box to practice on at home and I totally got over my fear. I'm so happy I bought this!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Zaborowski

customer_reviews.title: Just Unpacked - Updated
customer_reviews.text: The lightweight version is great. Not super heavy, doubts of it being sturdy unfounded. Came in good shape. Will update as I get started UPDATE: Very sturdy, holds weight evenly. Would recommend to anyone looking to get a jump box
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to your WODs
customer_reviews.text: Iv been using this box for approx 4 months constantly. Exercises include step ups, single leg lunges, dips, planks and box jumps. It has held up well so far with no rips or fading. It cleans up well if done frequently. For box jumps it really helps absorb the impact that wooden boxes create. It’s sturdy if keep on level ground. In addition it’s lightweight for its size. This was the best price on the market for this size, but the quality remains.
customer_reviews.author: (( T ))

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Held up well for a week until I tried the 30 inch jumps. The foam separated and I almost fell off. Can't handle 200+ lbs, and maybe even less. I took pictures to show how the glued foam layers come apart. My fix was some duct tape, and it's holding well now. I found the little sack with steel pellets in it which gives the item it's 16lb weight.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Great product anda  super value compared to the "Big" brands
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing crossfit and HIIT training for years and wanted to set up a home gym. This is a fantastic addition. I got the heavy one for stability on jumps and aggressive movements. The padding is a really plus to save the knees and wrists on explosive movements. I can't imagine getting a better quality as this is absolutely first rate AND it is about 1/2 the price as the big brand ones. Do yourself a favor if you are in the market for one of these and buy this one. You will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: once a giant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my daughter to work on her jumping. My concern with a wooden box was what if she doesn't nail the jump and lands on it... well, that is exactly what happened when she tried the 30" side. Instead of landing with a thud, she came up laughing and immediately tried again. In other words, it did exactly what I hoped it would do, encouraged her to try again instead of getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: John P Saxton

customer_reviews.title: Spilt seam in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for less than a week and the cover has already split on a seam. I will see if the manufacturer responds and sends me another cover. I figured over time I might have to use some duct tape on it, but never imagined that it would need it in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Foster

customer_reviews.title: So-so 😕
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular box because of the sparkling reviews However my opinion is, is that it just isn’t as sturdy as the other brands. I would not feel comfortable jumping on this at all. The patting is nice for if you do fall but the middle is just too soft. I don’t think I’d even want to do step ups on this box. Super unfortunate. It was delivered fast and the price was very reasonable compared to the other brands. Honestly now knowing how this box is I probably would have just paid the outrageous cost for a rogue one that I can jump on
customer_reviews.author: Its me again

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST jump box I have ever come across. Literally the worst. It’s made of a slippery, shiny outer material and the inside is not sturdy. The very first time I jumped on it the box slipped from underneath me- even though it was on on a rough concrete floor. I have used dozens of jump boxes at the gym and never once has a box slipped form under me just by jumping on to it. This thing will kill or paralyze someone. DONT BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Very Unstable and Squishy..
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed item and at first glance it looked perfect. Did some box jumps and immediately noticed that the box was extremely squishy and not stable at all. I weigh about 180 and if I added in any dumbbell step ups it would be sketchy at best to stay safe. At this point I am going to opt for the more expensive reputable brand on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Lighter weight not sturdy.  Would be worth the money to purchase the 60# box.
customer_reviews.text: I won’t be returning this, but it’s not as solid as I had hoped. It’s easy to pick up because of its weight, but its weight also makes it unsteady and moveable when jumping. Also if you don’t land with both feet completely on top, the edges push down too easy and may cause instability and possibly injury. Thinking there should be a weight somewhere in between the 16# and 60# that would be sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Super stable, high quality, and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and heavy! It feels equally stable for my 120 pound daughter as it does for my 250 pound husband. There's no movement at all. The material and stitching are really heavy. And the foam really alleviates the worry of clipping a shin on it. The adjustable height is fabulous. 3 of us are at 20" jumps, and one is at 30", and it can handle all of us.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Great for apprehensive box jumpers!
customer_reviews.text: I have banged up my chins several times on the traditional wood box at CrossFit. Seen way too many ugly boo boos on my work out buddies. so shopped around and purchased this padded box. Yes, first time I used it I did "bite" the box with my chins, BUT I was unscathed! Maybe one day I will be confident to use the "big girl box" but until then, this padded box is my best friend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best priced soft ply box that I've seen. I bought the lightweight version and it's fine for box jumps. I'm 170lbs and jump on the 24" side with no problem. The 30" side is also fine, but less stable so might slow down my reps. Super safe if you miss a jump and bump your shins since it's foam. All and all it's a great box and my 6yr old can use it no problem as well. If I were to buy again I'd probably buy the light one since it's so easy to move around the garage, but I would like to compare with a heavy box.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but light weight
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but shipping took about a month due to Covid-19. I am a small female and I was able to carry it down the stairs into my basement gym with no problems. It’s not as heavy as some boxes on the market, and because of that it will require some care when working out. I did one jump at the 20” height and the box skidded a few inches across my cement floor. I think I might have to use it on the non-skid padding or a yoga mat in the future, to prevent sliding/tipping. Other than that it seems like a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Gal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have had this box for about a year at my Tae Kwon Do school. It does not get super regular use and is not abused. The box is made with thick layers of dense foam that are glued together. The foam is great and has maintained its shape and density. At the beginning of the year, the layers separated. This has made the box almost useless as it is now too unstable to jump on unless you are using it at its shortest level. Even then you have to be careful. The outside covering has stood up well, though. I hope I can find some way to bind the layers back together without breaking down the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Good and not so good...wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Initial thoughts, both good and not so good. Good- I won’t get hurt jumping on this thing and striking my shins on it. Or falling into a corner, etc. It seems to be of high quality and durable. Not so good- I’m not sure the stability of the foam will allow for high box jumps. I did a jump on the 30in and it was very wobbly when I landed. This could help incorporate balance in my training, but it could also lead to me busting my butt. I’m still going to use it in my training and hopefully adjust to the semi wobbliness
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, solid box
customer_reviews.text: I'm so excited about this box. I bought it to work with clients and I love having three different heights to work with. I bought the 60lb box because after reading the reviews I didn't want to worry about it tipping over, especially as fatigue sets in and technique starts to fail for some, landing "just right" could be sketchy. It's heavy and very stable. Also the fact that it is foam and will save your shins from mishaps is a huge plus for me. I'm very happy with it and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megalynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Foam Jump Box
customer_reviews.text: This Jump Box is perfect and sturdier than I expected. We have used it for about 2 days now for about a total of 4 hours. To our surprise, it is still holding its original form. We placed this box in the center of the floor for 20 and 24 inches and it did not move or shift. We placed the box against the wall for 30-inch jumps for added support and safety, no problems. The box is durable for a Foam Box. We, of course, are not trying to put this Box through a QA Test or nothing, but we are using it for its purpose. So far, so good. We are pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JustaAvgConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Decent addition to home gym
customer_reviews.text: Decent addition to my home gym. Easy to clean. Non slip. I will primarily use for 20” (and hopefully 24”) box jumps which is Typically RX for women. I’m a Powerlifter and am in 82.5/90kg weight class so box is relatively sturdy and should be for most. Hopefully will stand up over time. ETA: a little wobbly when landing, especially when the jumps and landings get a little harder as the workout progresses and you tire. Make sure you land pretty center. It also has a zipper case which hopefully will stand up over time. Not crazy about the fairly large zipper pull tab flopping around either though.
customer_reviews.author: RoyBoy and LuLu's mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to My Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to find this box on Amazon and could not wait until it arrived. Once it did, I was not disappointed at all. I almost went for the lower priced (lower quality) box but am glad I deferred to the more expensive one here. It seems plenty durable and at 65lbs, stands up to anything I throw at it. There are no balance issues with this version due to that dense 65lb inner foam.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Sledge

customer_reviews.title: Are you sure you want the HEAVY one?
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our basement gym! We have it placed to help reach the ceiling mounted pullup bar, plus for box jumps of course. I ordered the 60 pound version for added stability. It's definitely stable, but this thing is HEAVY. Seems heavier than 60 pounds, but maybe that's just because it's also so large and awkward to move. I kind of wish we had got the lighter version to be easier to maneuver around, most reviews say it is still sturdy/stable. This one does the job though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: This Jump Trainer is very sturdy and very well made. Our daughter really likes it and enjoys using it to enhance her jumping skills. The only negative would be maneuverability. I understand that the weight is part of what makes it sturdy and stable, but it is very difficult for either myself or my daughter to move the Jumpbox to a different location. Just an FYI, before purchasing, I knew the weight from reading the description, so I already knew that would be an issue and which is what makes it so that I would still give this item a 5 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Whippster

customer_reviews.title: Everything to love about this plyo box.
customer_reviews.text: Wow when I picked this up for the first time I expected more heft and was pleasantly surprised. I’m very used to the wooden ploy boxes and their cumbersome size. I’m a smaller than average woman so this box has been a gift from heaven. I never used a foam one before and was very satisfied with its ability to handle being jumped, moved and pushed around. I’ve only had it a few days but I haven’t been gentle with it. My husband and I even used it as a step up to work on my car while on jack stands! It’s been very useful in both my garage gym and my garage shop. I love it 🥰
customer_reviews.author: Denise Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for use in a small home gym and it is perfect for that. I am certain that the 60 lb version would provide a little more stability but I need to constantly move this around secondary to lack of room in my home gym and I am sure the 60 lb version would make that very difficult. The 16 lb version is awesome and provides a good amount of stability plus it actually makes you think about landing perfectly which works on your balance and coordination.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - heavy and still wobbles, but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: I went with the sturdy version, knowing it was going to be heavy and difficult to maneuver, but I hoped that it would have a more solid feel to it due to the weight. I am comfortable using on the 20" and 24" sides, but I do not like using the 30" side as it feels very wobbly when landing on it. It seems very durable as I am forced to leave it outside on an uncovered patio where I do my workouts and I have not seen any issues with wear and tear from the weather or from use at this point.
customer_reviews.author: James Mahaffey

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Light Sturdy Versatile Box
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this foam Plyo box! Great height choices and so stable!! I’ve done weighted step ups and bodyweight jumps onto the box, as well as places my weight in my hands on the box and jumping over or doing inversions. I’ve tried all heights and felt secure in each position. It’s so easy to move and flip, too! Easy to clean and disinfect which will be very important as my family uses this. We’ll see how well it stands up to to heavier bodies and use over time but it dies have a great warranty!
customer_reviews.author: WASK

customer_reviews.title: Favorite new "toy" in our house!
customer_reviews.text: Love this box! I was looking for a foam box that I could use indoors without shoes, and this is perfect! I bought it for myself, but as it turns out the whole family (including my husband, 6 yr old, and 10 yr old daughters) all love it! While everyone is jumping on the box for fun, they're also getting fit! The box is sturdy but light enough to move around and flip as desired. I had no problems with stability when jumping onto it even at the 30" height!
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied, exactly as advertised. Very happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16lb version. It is extreamly easy to move around the house, it is quite stable on the 20" and 24" sides and fairly stable on the 30" side (using it for dips and steps, not jumping). I love the foam vs the wood competitors which I have cut up my shins on several occasions. the price was very reasonable after looking at the competition. I am 170lbs, when jumping on the 20" side, it is very solid yet offers a lighter landing. The only problem is now I wish I had more of these in different sizes, my kids are fighting over it all the time as though its a big foam block toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: different than a wood box, but good
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty hesitant about box jumps; not my favorite. This was different than a wood box for sure, but didn't wobble at all (20"). Didn't feel as sturdy as a wood box, but it didn't budge/move. Someone else jumped on the 24" side and it didn't seem to move at all from my point of view. Great for building confidence; someone got their first 20" box jump with this today!! Might be fun to add these to WOD for carrying heavy objects around!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Rappe

customer_reviews.title: Nice jump box
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review. Still happy with quality of box, but disappointed with customer support. Box is not cheap, but quality is good. As part of warranty card, they solicited feedback on product and offered jumprope as incentive to provide feedback. When I followed requirements they established, they changed the requirements. When I said I had already provided required documentation, they still insisted I fill out extra paperwork. Jumprope is not worth effort to comply with changing requirements.
customer_reviews.author: pems-integ-tests

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality!
customer_reviews.text: I did so much research before buying this plyo box trying to find a reasonably priced product without sacrificing quality and wow this is it! Sure, I have only used it twice so far, so I can't say much to its longevity just yet, but it appears well made, sturdy, and best of all no more fear of bashing my shins!! It's also something that I can grow into as I can only currently jump onto the 20 inch side. As I practice and get more agile I hope to eventually manage the 30 inch! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a foam plyo box as I still bear scars from my days in track & field having to jump on the old wood ones. This this took a while to ship, but once received, it seems rock solid. While I'd highly recommend leaning this against a wall if you're jumping onto the 30" height, it is stable overall. There is minimal give on this box, which is great as I originally thought it might be a bit too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Kannon30

customer_reviews.title: Great jumping box!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product from the time I opened it. It's super light and super sturdy. I even had my husband who's about 6 ft tall 245 lb try it out no problems. I purchased it to help me get over the fear of doing box jumps on the wooden boxes at my gym . I use it often and the product is holding up very well. I would suggest this product for anyone. It's easily portable if you need to bring it anywhere with you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Plyometric box
customer_reviews.text: The plyometric box arrived as expected. Because of the different weights within our household, I ordered the heavy duty one and we are all loving it! The box is about 60lbs and can be turned to meet each of the three different levels of jumping. I would recommend this plyometric box to any one who wants to challenge themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Ahnie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty (60LB) Version is Very Stable
customer_reviews.text: I opted for the heavier 60lb version, and so far it has been very stable during box jumps and step ups. I weigh 185lbs, and found very little movement during fast paced box jump WODs. It has already saved my shins and knees a few times when you get tired during the end of a workout, and inevitably miss a jump. With the softer padding, I'm able to jump with confidence and not worry about gashing up shins on a metal or wooden box. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McQueen

customer_reviews.title: Box Jump
customer_reviews.text: Honestly when I lifted the box (package) to to bring it into my garage I was shocked how light weight it is. I guess I missed the point that it is a light weight box. Well I am going to try it. It looks like it is pretty stable on the ground. So I read a lot of reviews and it looks like they are all great. If it works out I am happy that the box is light weight. I will give another update in a few weeks after using it for a while. Other then that the box itself looks great, shipping was fantastic. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter for plyo training. She absolutely LOVES it. With the 3 height options it's challenging for her and still leaves room to grow. It is plenty stable for her at 5' and about 95 lbs. I am 6' 1" and about 185 lbs. It works great for me as well. 20" and 24" are super stable. 30" can be a bit wobbly if you don't land evenly, but should be expected as such with the lighter weight version of the box. At this price point, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J-Dub

customer_reviews.title: 16 lb Box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this box over the heavier one so that we could move it around easier since we don’t have one dedicated room for working out. It’s definitely easy to move from one room to another. It’s fairly sturdy for a light weight box but it does shake and move a bit if you don’t land exactly right, especially on the 30 inch side. That being said, it’s nice for beginners because it’s very forgiving. My 6 year old daughter is trying to learn box jumps on the 20 inch side and hasn’t had to worry about scraped shins or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This box is  must for your Training!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: No matter your level of fitness this box is right for you. Even if you cannot jump on the box there are a multitude of exercises that you can still do. You can work your way up to do a specific goal tailored to you. I purchased the 60 pound because my wife does not have much experience with box jumps and I wanted her to be as safe as possible. Great Buy Definitely worth the Money!
customer_reviews.author: 17 B-Ball Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome box!
customer_reviews.text: While I was worried about the stability of this “box”, it has proven to be very sturdy! I’ve used it for 3 WOD’s so far, and love it! It takes all the fear out of box jumps! We have ours in our garage gym with gym mat flooring and it stays out! No slipping or sliding. I feel much more confident with box jumps now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box jump sturdy yet light to move around
customer_reviews.text: I received the product in advance of planned delivery date in good condition. I started using the product right away. I was nicely surprised that the box is solid and does not tip over even when I jumped on the edge of it. The zipper will hopefully permit a change of the vinyl cover should it need replacement in the future.
customer_reviews.author: richard tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Was using the heavy version at the gym - with many positive reviews decided to try. At 6' and 220#, part of my cross fit is a standing jump on the 30" end - its very stable - holds my weight - no shifting or compression - more forgiving than a plywood plyometric - slip on that & its a serious ouch. It's proving to be a quality item and with the lighter weight, very easy to store away on a high shelf - a plus for when my wife wants to use it
customer_reviews.author: Cabdoor

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used to save a few bucks and it arrived in great condition. It’s super light weight but that’s what’s bad about it. I’ve fallen a few times because it’s not stable. Im used to using the wooden or metal boxes they have at the gym. It has to be against a wall so it’s stable and that’s annoying. For the price I paid, I’d rather pay $100 more for the Titan Plyo Box which is heavy duty and is stable. I guess you get what you get for being cheap. Don’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Great ploy box for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with,, you don't need the 60 lbs box, I'm 5'10 and 220 lbs and this box keeps itself stable even after jumping many times on it or using it with weights. By only been 16 lbs is incredibly sturdy and quite capable of balancing my weight and even my wife loves it. She can move around and jump on it without been worry of hurting herself. Is a great HIIT companion.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel H.

customer_reviews.title: Way more steady than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that it would be wobbly or slide after reading some of the reviews. I got the "light" version and it is very solid. I am a clumsy box jumper and even with my own wobbliness the box held steady and did not slide even on a slick linoleum type flooring. Also I am right at 200 lbs and there was very little sinking from jumping or sitting on it. I highly recommend. ** there is no way I can jump 30" (maybe I will get there one day) so I can't judge by jumping experience but it seems pretty sturdy **
customer_reviews.author: sammy mull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent plyo box!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this box over several others after reading the mainly great reviews. My wife injured her meniscus several months ago and couldn’t use a wood box for workouts, much too hard, she loves this soft, yet sturdy box. It’s held up great and still looks and feels brand new. We have a few (other brand) soft plyo boxes at our gym and nearly everyone prefers our box. It’s more sturdy at higher heights than other boxes at our gym, I’d strongly recommend this box to others.
customer_reviews.author: M Recoon

customer_reviews.title: Good home training tool
customer_reviews.text: When you trying to train for extra burst in jumping, there aren't too many equipments to use. This is one of them. The exterior is study enough and given that the inside is foam filled, it's pretty stable to train on. If you want something really stable, something solid like wood-based would be the only thing better. It's versatile enough that I've used it not only to do jump training but also for push-ups and dips on.
customer_reviews.author: mchwang

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Sturdy Box
customer_reviews.text: These Plyometric boxes are heavy (60 pounds) which makes it a bit difficult to maneuver, but my 12 year old is able to move it simply enough by flipping it. The dimensions are right on, and the foam is far sturdier than you might think - but yields the benefit of more confident jumps since the risk of scarred shins and bruised knees disappears with this box. The only downside is that when using the 30" height, it does tend to be a little wobbly, but moving it against anything of weight or substance fixes it in a second. Great box!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Claprood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 10 year old who is non-stop energy. The product is solid, well constructed, and came in great shape. We love the soft material over the entire box. We were worried it would be cumbersome to move since it's so heavy, but it's not bad at all, my son can move it himself (by pushing it end over end over our carpet). We are very glad we bought the heavy version of this because it is very nice to not have to prop it against the wall for stability like we would have to if it was light weight. Overall a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build out my home gym since I stopped my gym membership due to COVID. I was pleasantly surprised at the sturdiness of the box, particularly at its highest point of 30". Wooden boxes still have a lot more sturdiness to them however this box is easier to move around and also has the benefit of being padded. I have plenty of scars on my shins from missing the jump on wood boxes so this is a great low consequence box particularly for people just starting out on box jumps.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Good for Exercise and Volleyball jumping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 215 lb husband and it works great! Became a party favor one night with teenagers jumping 30 inch! Holds everyone’s weight. I still like to be careful and not put it near windows or fireplace...but it definitely works and is sturdy. I imagine the heavier version might work better for my nerves (more stable); however, we haven’t had any issues with this lighter one! Have owned it for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Aimston

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of the plyo box. It is heavy duty and sturdy. The 20 and 24 inch side are extremley stable because of the larger surface area. The 30 inch side has a little more wobble to it naturally becuse of the height, smaller surface area and padding. Overall, a solid product and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Very solid to jump onto and great to have 1 box with 3 sizes!!
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect! One item and you can turn it to 3 different heights. So far it has held up well. The kids love it as well and gets them ready to go for sports. Very solid product and definitely a win with the guys in my house! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sturdy Plyo Box
customer_reviews.text: Love the three height levels as well as the fact that it is sturdy and does not slip. Sturdy enough to prevent falling, but light enough to move when not using. Great product. To make it extra sturdy, we use it next to a bed so it doesn't tip.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah H.

customer_reviews.title: Stable yet Light!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very sturdy and stable platform, while being quite light, only 16 pounds. We use it both as a jump box but also as a stable and very moveable mounting platform for a high pull up bar (which can be removed during practice and put back to dismount with minimal effort). I really like the easy to read dimension numbers on the side of the box which allow for quick set up changes without guessing which is the 20” vs the 24” side!! Overall I am very happy with the purchase and my younger housemates love playing on the box! :-)
customer_reviews.author: The Doer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this box to add to my home gym, which is under a carport, and therefore semi exposed to the elements. I wanted a soft one so there would be less concern with moisture, and my kiddos won’t hurt themselves if they decide to use it. It is exactly as I expected. It held its position when I jumped on it on the 20 inch side. I will update once I have overcome my fear of the 24 inch side ha ha. It’s stood up to my six-year-old jumping on it and landing on his knees with no visible dents.
customer_reviews.author: B. Richard

customer_reviews.title: Useful box!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this box about 2 weeks for 3 teen athletes, and it's a great training tool. The box scoots forward very slightly sometimes (with landings close to the edge of the box), but it's never been enough to make the jumper feel like she'll fall off. When the jumper misses, she can land on her knees, so there are no bruises or scraped shins. The landing surface is ample. One teen has gotten past her previous jump box fears by using this box at home - a nice victory. (For safety and support, we spot each other.) It seems that it will take a lot of use to wear out the cover or damage the foam inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very quick delivery. Came eady to use. 5 minutes after receiving it my kids were all over it putting it through the ringer. They love it and if it keeps them busy and active well worth the money. I ordered it for my online crossfit classes. On my test jumps and step up seems more sturdy than I was expecting. The little bit of cushion it has is great for my poor downstairs neighbor. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the jump box is a bit on the flimsy side. The cover is lose and it slides around too much. It's strong enough to jump on it plenty of times, but only time will tell how long it'll last. I recommend putting it against a wall when you're about to jump on it to avoid it from moving or flipping on you. I gave it four stars because it still works, but I think if the cover was on tighter it would be worth a solid 5.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Trust the box!
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived in great condition. I was hesitant to jump onto the box because it was very light. However, the box was sturdy, stable and easy to move around. Perfect height for I am 5’7” at 185lbs; 45 y/o. No complaints and I trust this box.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY recommend you get the 60pound version and not the 15. This is 60pounds and moves a little on concrete floor so I couldnt imagine using the lighter version. Users are 100,135 and 170 pounds. NICE product!
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. Doe

customer_reviews.title: Room for Goals!
customer_reviews.text: After three nasty injuries on the gym's diamond-cut metal boxes, I decided to get a soft box. Then the pandemic happened & they were gone, "POOF", just like that. I kept searching daily and finally came across this BalanceFrom Jump Trainer Box. The other ones I had looked at only went up to 24", this is the first one that goes up to 30" that I found. At 5'5, I can do the 24" on the soft box without trepidation. With jeans on, I tried the 30", and while I didn't make it, it has given me a new goal! Sturdy, no rocking, and no fear of jagged-sharp-scar-inducing edges! I love it & will use it FOREVER!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Lane

customer_reviews.title: Not much thought given to packaging
customer_reviews.text: My only frustration with this is how it was packaged. The unit is completely flush to the edges of the box; no protective foam provided. Why would foam be needed, if the entire thing is soft and built to withstand impact? Well since there was no warning on the box, I tried to cut it open with a box cutter, and sliced right through the item. Something like this should (and usually does) have some protective layer (even simple wads of paper) to prevent this very thing :(
customer_reviews.author: Buzzy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Used my box jump several times now and I'm very pleased with my purchase. I was worried it wasn't going to be as sturdy as a wooden box but the stability of this box jump has impressed me so far! It's not heavy at all to pick up and move around. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this box!
customer_reviews.author: Yxa C. Dahms

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: We bought this jump-box in order to work out at home. We are completely satisfied. We actually used this today (25 May 2020) for the first time and it worked great. Would recommend purchasing the heavier version of this same jump box as this one is a bit light and unstable when jumping on the box. All we did was butt it up against something sturdy so it would not move. Highly recommend this item! We are seriously thinking about purchasing another box!
customer_reviews.author: Byron Morales

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home gym!
customer_reviews.text: Got this foam box for Christmas and WOW I was super excited. I jumped up on the 30” side and I feel it was just as sturdy as the ones at gym. It was super stable and had no movement either. Moving it around isn’t bad, however some sort of handles would be great. I don’t like to drag or slide so I’m having to reach around it to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Stable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the heavy model and was very skeptical about a 200 lb person doing a 30" box jump on something made of foam. Opened the box and was impressed with the quality. In no time the whole family was jumping and it is very stable. It doesn't slide at all and most importantly it easily hold my weight even when I land close to the edge. Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved this jumping box. I had built her a wooden one but was terrified she would hurt her leg against the plywood so a couple of months later, she found these types of boxes. She was looking at another brand but was more expensive so I decided to go with this one which had awesome reviews. I am so happy I went with this one instead and my wife loves it so thank you for making me the hero.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and good heights
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a Box Jump for about a year, after I was on one at a gym I was visiting. Theirs was wooden box and very stable. When I researched buying one, I found it too expensive. Then I had the opportunity to borrow a Foam Plyometric Box Jump box during quarantine and loved it. This was better priced (although still more than I had hope to spend) and easy to carry. The box is great for jumping on and leaning on for exercise. I am a 55 year old women who loves to work out. I can jump the 20 inch height. Get the heart rate up, works the legs, hips and core.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great for box jumps, even better for your shins!
customer_reviews.text: This item works great. As good as high price name brand soft box jumps. Now, they might not hold up to 20-30 people a day using them 20 to 30 workouts, but for your daily workouts it should hold up great. Even my 11yr old loves to do box jumps on this! Good investment for your home gym!
customer_reviews.author: JuleeRR

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Order this box jump!
customer_reviews.text: So I waited a little while to write this review because right when I received it I was recovering from a knee injury. So far I’m loving this box jump. I have used both the 20 inch for step ups and the 24 inch for box jumps. I’ve been hesitant to do the 30 inch with my knee, but I feel it’s sturdy enough once I’m comfortable again. All in all a great buy for my home gym and my WODs!
customer_reviews.author: BJB1981

customer_reviews.title: Holy foam Batman
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Loved it as soon as I opened it. Long time athlete who hasn’t done box jumps in about 9 years. Started as soon as I opened it. Even had my niece do some who is in cheer. She loved it too. Pretty sturdy for being foam. Did not expect it to be this good. Will see what time will tell. But excited for this plyo box.
customer_reviews.author: Yo-Yo

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of submitting product reviews too soon. First take though this box is solid, I purchased the heavy one and it is heavy. But jumping onto it is solid and I have only ever jumped onto solid boxes not something like this although it does feel nice and it doesn't move. Time will tell how it holds up and if the outside material doesn't tear and if the inside material doesn't breakdown. Edit: This company entices you to write a review with the claim you will receive a free jump rope. They emailed saying they could not make good on this deal. Poor marketing and business.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Solid box but zipper broke within two months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my home gym and it's very durable. My husband and I can both use it for workouts. it is pretty heavy, but I prefer that since I feel like it's secure and won't slip from under us. UPDATE: I added a photo to update our review. The zipper has broken on us and we are not getting any product support. We made multiple attempts to contact the company and have gotten zero response.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Love this plyo box! Great for building your jumping confidence (especially if you have ever banged up your shins on the more traditional boxes). We have purchased the lightweight version in addition to the heavier version. The lightweight version has held up very well over the past 2 years or so. We purchased the heavier version for a few reasons this time around. 1- The lightweight version was on back order and 2- Hoping for increased ground stability. Bottom line, you can't go wrong with this plyo box....the cost is perfect and you get the same benefits from the higher priced boxes. We have used the lightweight box for a wide variety of exercises and it has worked out perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the home gym.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. We bought this for our home gym. We try to pick up a good workout tool every year. We have been using an old tractor tire for the last couple years. This jump box will be a well used addition. 3 different sizes. 20”, 24” & 30”. I have already put this thru the paces of its first WOD. It did exactly as expected. And it looks great too. And no scraped shins- Hehe
customer_reviews.author: Kurt M. Altig

customer_reviews.title: Not a purchase you’ll regret.
customer_reviews.text: Please with the product. Appeared as stated. Does not hurt the knees when you jump on it. Sturdy on all heights, and lightweight. I can easily carry it and turn it over in timely fashion. Was hesitant to make the purchase, but glad I finally did. Great piece of equipment to up the ante on my workouts. I received this within 22 days from purchase (was also a two-day prime purchase).
customer_reviews.author: Her

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Had looked for quite awhile at a variety of different box jumps and settled on this type because of space concerns (vs. having 3 different stands/boxes). Have found it to be very stable and sturdy (despite light weight of box), versatile (different sizes) and texture on box prevents you from sliding when landing. Well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Tom McLean

customer_reviews.title: Great box for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This box has helped me with my fear of box jumps, its much cheaper than I have seen anywhere else. The one I bought is pretty heavy so it makes it more challenging to move around. But if you have knee issues or worry about missing on a wooden box this is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A great buy for for box jump practice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the box for my wife who is doing crossfit and wanted a tool to practice her box jumps. The box is of really high quality and very sturdy. It has been a great tool so far and the softer material makes it easier mentally to jump on than a wood box with hard edges. Overall a great buy and would recommend for anyone who wants a high quality box for jump practice.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Great jump box
customer_reviews.text: This box is perfect and is exactly what I was wanting. I used it to do box jump burpees and it worked perfectly. You have to make sure it's on a solid surface to give the most stability, so I wouldn't recommend using it on carpet. Also, I have rubber gym mats which are perfect to keep it from sliding. Putting it on the garage floor was too slippery and caused it to slide a lot. It is solidly made and although I've only used it once, it seems like it will be able to handle my somewhat rigorous workouts. I am very satisfied. The price was very reasonable too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what my home gym has been missing!
customer_reviews.text: Much sturdier than I anticipated! And yet still soft enough that I no longer have to worry about ruining my shins if I come up short on a jump. I am using this as a bench also and it is nice and cushy on my back for moves done laying down. Great for step ups and hop overs and elevated push ups! Very versatile piece of equipment and great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Leah D Rector

customer_reviews.title: Great except for slight instability.
customer_reviews.text: Thing is as described. However, when buying the heavy version, I thought it would have more stability when stepping down from the top when at the 30". It actually can almost tip over depending on how you step down (I am 5'10" 200#). Besides that, it is good!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Get it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Since the zombie apocalypse I’ve been working out mostly at home and was looking for a box similar to the foam ones at my gym. This is a very good product. I’ve used it on hard wood floors, carpet, grass, concrete, and it is very stable! The only thing is that it kind of had a chemically smell when it came so I just left it on the back porch for a while and it’s fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but STURDY.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Father's Day. He has been wanting one, and the sets are expensive, so this will do for now. He loves it. Uses it every other morning. He said for lightweight foam (or whatever it's made of) it's pretty sturdy and holds up to some jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Ouisa

customer_reviews.title: Ok, just don’t use it for plyos
customer_reviews.text: This is not bad. It works well for non-plyomeyrics, such as split squats, light weight set ups (not stable or sturdy enough for heavy), and I can do some nice stretching and core stuff with it. In the meantime it works well as a table! Just NEVER do plyos with this.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I've done a few workouts with this plyo box and i have to say for the price I couldn't have asked for a better piece of equipment. Background is crossfit so i'll be using this primarily as a boxjump/stepup. I would take off a star for stability, but the box only weighs 16 pounds and has stood up to some decent workouts to date. Unable to comment on the sturdiness at this time but i hope this holds up for a couple years well have to see. Overall very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shane fujio

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: Box is light weight so you need make sure to jump solid and in the middle. It may tilt if you don't land correctly. Overall product is great and the options of 20,24,30 jumps is its best feature. It is exactly what I was looking for. Once I posted it on social media, several folks asked where I purchased it. This is a great item for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Great Box for Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: It's a great box for combo box for beginners or expert jumpers. Is it as rock solid as a wood box no, but it is stable enough to normal workouts and allow others to train and get used to box jumps without all the scars.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: A good Plyo-box for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I use wood and high end foam plyo boxes at the gym. This is substantially heavier and not as stable. With that being said, it is also less than 1/2 the price, making it a good value. It works perfect for step-ups, roman lunges and other exercises requiring a box. Jumping on the 20" or 24" is good, the 30" is somewhat sketchy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to exercise routine
customer_reviews.text: This box is very sturdy, construction seems to be great! Some care needs to be taken during use since it is lighter than wooden boxes and can more easily tip, but the benefit of being able to easily move this out of the way outweighs this issue. I am very pleased with this purchase. Added bonus is that the corners are soft so no scraped shins in the off chance you miss a jump.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A Wunsch

customer_reviews.title: Great overall soft plyo box
customer_reviews.text: I will admit it, we ordered a bunch of different things for our home workouts in a COVID-induced panic. Of all the things we ordered, this has been one of the best. The box is stable, and so far has been great in terms of not slipping. No issues with any of the sides, either. It's obviously heavy, but the price you pay for stability and a soft box. Worth it, in my mind. Overall, we really like it and are glad that we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Adler

customer_reviews.title: Totally sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this jump box, its exactly what I was looking for due to SIP and gym being closed. The box is sturdy and has 3 different jump sizes in the one box. My wife and kids are also using it now. I also use it for bench press's and bicep dips, it hold perfectly and does not topple. We have even used it as an extra dining table chair too! Great product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Gym (and prof gym too)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to practice box jumps during the pandemic so I purchased. The product is extremely sturdy and I really wish this box was at my gym. Its heavy which is why I didn't rate 5 for maneuverability but I suppose the weight is a result of it being a quality product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use box jump trainer
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been working from home. We wanted a box for jumps, step ups, and a bench substitute. What a great product. This is soft enough in case we miss a step up, l so we don’t worry about hurting our shins. I used it as a bench too and it was sturdy enough for my 210lb+ body. Great product and made so easy with Amazon. No assembly needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Taba

customer_reviews.title: My fear of box jumps is gone!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this jump box and I love it. I have done CrossFit for a year now and box jumps have been my biggest fear until now. Got this box and jumped 20” side today for the first time ever. The fear is gone!!!! My 9 year old daughter went right to it! Love love love it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: kelly stady

customer_reviews.title: great design! versatile use!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new plyo box! I was thinking about getting three different boxes to get the dimensions but I was wary about space...and all my options for 3 sizes were made of wood or plastic...I love that I got my 3 dimensions AND that it is a soft box. Love the design! Very versatile. I can use it for box jumps, step-ups, like a bench for dips, and have also been using it to get to my pull up rig. I'm glad I went with the heavier version too. I don't know about the lighter version but this one is not too hard to move and the weight provides stability. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a jump box.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Mangual

customer_reviews.title: Light enough to move, yet sturdy to jump on
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 year old son who is an Ice Hockey goalie. It is a great core strength and leg muscle builder which is required for his sport and position. Its well made and sturdy for use, and its light enough to easily move around. The case looks to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kind

customer_reviews.title: Home Gym Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how sturdy this was! I did a lot of research and knew I didn’t want a regular wooden box and am so happy with this decision! I recently started doing CrossFit and I love doing box jumps. This makes me feel comfortable doing them without the nerve of jacking my legs on a box! Great home gym addition!!
customer_reviews.author: MP

product_meta.title: BalanceFrom 3 in 1 20" 24" 30" Foam Plyometric Box Jumping Exercise (Heavy Duty, 60 Pounds)
product_meta.description:
Overview: If you want to get back into shape, burn away those unsightly love handles, get a strong body from top to bottom, and be a healthy person in general, it’s time to start working out, and there is no better place to start than with the good old box jump. You may be wondering why box jumps are so great and why we would even be talking about them.

Well, the fact of the matter is that the benefits of box jumps are very diverse and can go a very long way in making you a fit and healthy person with a fantastic looking beach body. Box jumps aren’t just for people training for a specific sport though, because they hold the same benefits for everybody and anybody. Keep reading to find out what all of the wonderful benefits are that box jumping holds for you!

16lb Specifications: 
- Material: Foam 
- Height: 20" 
- Width: 24" 
- Length: 30" 
- Weight: 16 lb

60lb Specifications: 
- Material: Foam 
- Height: 20" 
- Width: 24" 
- Length: 30" 
- Weight: 60 LB
feature_bullets: Two styles - Regular style weighs 16 pounds, heavy duty style weights 60 pounds
Three in one - simply rotate the box to get 20-inch, 24-inch and 30-inch
No injuries - durable foam material so you don’t have to worry about getting injured
Anti-slip - the surface is a slip-free, meaning you can have stability with every single set of jumps
All genuine Balance From products are covered by a 100% Balance From satisfaction support and 2-year Balance From Support

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
